intro: Discocactus zehntneri subsp. mirohalfarii, commonly known as the Mirohalfarii discocactus, is a rare and unusual cactus native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its short, thick stems that are often covered in a waxy coating, which helps it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces small, white flowers during the cooler months, typically in spring or early summer. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-draining soil and full sunlight. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a conservation concern.
